attributes.action: allow MPs to debate a motion of No Confidence in the Speaker of the House of Commons
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: MPs wish to debate a motion of No Confidence in the Speaker of the House of Commons. In order to do this the motion needs the backing of the Government. The Government needs to get out of the way and allow a matter of great concern to the public and our elected representatives to be debated. Failure to allow the matter to be debated at the earliest opportunity risks bringing the Government, the House of Commons and the Office of Speaker into disrepute.

rejection.details: Speaker Michael Martin announced on May 19 he will step down in June.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
